Line 393: Line 393:
===Nov 14===
===Nov 14===
[[File:Occupy Oakland - Nov 14 - allegedly badgeless officers.jpg|thumb|November 14 - Men in riot gear, allegedly without any visible insignia, stand in a police line.]]
[[File:Occupy Oakland - Nov 14 - allegedly badgeless officers.jpg|thumb|November 14 - Men in riot gear, allegedly without any visible insignia, stand in a police line.]]
â
In the days preceding November 14, Oakland Police delivered 'notices of violations' were delivered to Frank Ogawa plaza. In the early hours of November 14, approximately 700-1000 police were mobilized. Supporters began arriving, and union members organized a picket line. At approximately 4:30 AM, police entered the plaza. Police initially made about 20 arrests of the camp's Interfaith Ministry who remained in the camp. Afterwards, police demolished the camp.
+
In the days preceding November 14, Oakland Police delivered 'notices of violations' to Frank Ogawa plaza. In the early hours of November 14, approximately 700-1000 police were mobilized. Supporters began arriving, and union members organized a picket line. At approximately 4:30 AM, police entered the plaza. Police initially made about 20 arrests of the camp's Interfaith Ministry who remained in the camp. Afterwards, police demolished the camp.
â
[[Dan Siegel]], legal adviser to Mayor Jean Quan's legal adviser resigned his post in protest, and post, via Facebook: "No longer Mayor Quan's legal adviser. Resigned at 2 am. Support Occupy Oakland, not the 1% and its government facilitators." <ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 "Mayor's legal adviser quits over police raid"]</ref>
+
[[Dan Siegel]], Mayor Jean Quan's city hall Legal Adviser, resigned in protest, announcing, via Facebook: "No longer Mayor Quan's legal adviser. Resigned at 2 am. Support Occupy Oakland, not the 1% and its government facilitators." <ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 "Mayor's legal adviser quits over police raid"]</ref>
A citizen-journalist on the scene reported that some of the the men clad in police riot gear lacked any badges and would not provide badge numbers when questioned. <ref>[http://www.ustream.tv/occupyoakland OakFoSho]<!-- Better source needed for long term--></ref>
A citizen-journalist on the scene reported that some of the the men clad in police riot gear lacked any badges and would not provide badge numbers when questioned. <ref>[http://www.ustream.tv/occupyoakland OakFoSho]<!-- Better source needed for long term--></ref>
